Comentario:
Un juego muy especial que es la definición de aventura.
FFVII Rebirth me provoca las mismas sensaciones que aquellos final fantasy de PS1 o PS2 de que estoy viviendo una aventura sin igual,
repleta de personajes fascinantes y con una banda sonora que es capaz de emocionar en los momentos mas bonitos y épicos del juego, El combate es directamente no uno de los mejores de la saga sino de cualquier JRPG, espectacular y tan complicado como tu quieras hacerlo, si bien es cierto que no te hace falta dominarlo a no ser que hagas contenido secundario donde están las batallas mas complicadas y que necesitaran su propia estrategia como las de las invocaciones o algún jefe secreto. 
Después de 90 horas y haber hecho casi todo el contenido del titulo lo único de lo que me puedo quejar es de la repetición de ciertas actividades en el mundo abierto y de que aun falten seguramente unos 4 años para saber el desenlace de la historia de Cloud y todo su grupo.
Un juego muy especial y hecho con un cariño inimaginable que se nota a cada paso que das por su maravilloso y bonito mundo, 95/100

Comentario:
A game I want to love, based on a classic I dived into back in the 90's. I want to follow the story, but keep getting interrupted. Every small thing I do, I keep getting repeats from Chadley or just the game in general. I'm obviously so stupid, the game needs to treat me like a three-year old. And the mini games, please for the love of God, I didn't want a Ubisoft collect the entire map of solo Mario Party time wasters. Yes, I can skip most of that. Not all... and yes, skipping it means I also will be skipping the RPG grind, because I can't just do J-RPG stuff... Where are all the REAL side quests? Not MMO side quests... Ch. 11 seems to be my limit, or I need a vacation before I finish this game. Should have been a game people wanted Plat trophy for, not rage deleting. And I know I'm not alone with my unpopular opinion.

PS. The subtitles are for the English VA's. If you want Japanese, you better know the language or have the same weird (and blatantly wrong) dialogues in the subs.

Comentario: Final Fantasy VII is my favorite Final Fantasy game and the Remake was amazing, however, it was merely a prologue of a bigger narrative that took place in a linear world, and it couldn't show its true potential yet. With Final Fantasy VII Rebirth though, it finally did; featuring the middle act of Final Fantasy VII's story and an open world filled with content, this game is everything Final Fantasy VII fans dreamed ****, the story and the characters remain very faithful to the original game for the most part, however, Rebirth expanded on them in every way possible, and they absolutely nailed them. Unfortunately, I don't really like some of the new story additions to be honest, but at least they don't get in the way of the main story; in fact, the main story is even better than in the original game so **** for the open world, it has repetitive structure for sure, however, it's filled with surprises, rewards and content, and the towns are the most detailed I've ever seen in a **** gameplay has been improved upon in every way, from aerial combat to exploration, reworked movesets, mini-games, synergy skills, new limit breaks, better quest design, and more.Also, the visuals are gorgeous despite some blurry textures, and the music is just unbelievable; every single corner of the game has a banger in it, and the rearranged tracks are absolutely wonderful.Pros:+ Expanded story and characters+ Open world filled with content+ Excellent gameplay+ Breathtaking graphics+ Incredible musicCons:- Inconsistent writingNarrative: 8/10Gameplay: 10/10Content: 10/10Characters: 10/10Music: 10/10Graphics/Audio: 9/10Final Rating: 10/10- Masterpiece -Final Fantasy VII Rebirth is a JRPG masterpiece that honors Final Fantasy VII's legacy to the fullest and marks the new "Golden Age" for the Final Fantasy series, 20 years later.With Rebirth, the Remake compilation is shaping up to be my new favorite installment in my favorite videogame series of all **** I recommend it?:Must-play for Final Fantasy VII fans.Newcomers should at least play the Remake prior to playing Rebirth.

Overall a pretty poorly made game. Button mashy overly frenetic combat. Awkward open world navigating (jumping up and down obstacles looks like a high schooler animated it). Pretty cringey dialogue in a lot of spots. 

Majority of your gameplay is spent in rhythm mini games that appear to be intentionally designed to frustrate the player. Just an absolute shotgun blast of annoying button timing and awkward hand dexterity movements. Ive seen some people online defending the mini games and it blows my mind that people like this can exist. I dont know how we can have fallen so far as a species.

Unless you are very obstinately playing final fantasy games for the brand name, you should probably skip this one. I would certainly rank it among one of the lesser titles SE has barfed up.

Comentario: Der erste Teil war schon eine Faszination für mich, vorallem als die Ankündigung mit dem Trailer kam. Der Hauptgrund ist definitiv die Nostalgie aber auch die Liebe zum Detail und die Energie, Schweiß, Tränen, Blut. Alles konnte ich im ersten Teil spüren. Nachdem ich die Nostalgie Brille abnahm, erkannte ich auch die Nachteile. Das Kampfssystem sah und sieht auch in dem Teil Super aus aber macht mir eigentlich kein Spaß ist mir zu überladen, kompliziert und ohne Erfolgserlebniss. Auch die Sidequests oder die Minigames usw. waren doch relativ lieblos bzw. belanglos und waren eher für das strecken der Spielzeit gedacht. So fühlte es sich zumindest an. Trotzdessen war es eine 7-8 von 10 für mich. ABEEER der Teil ist einfach nur ein Meisterwerk. Bis jetzt habe ich 40 Stunden Spielzeit und habe jegliche Nebenmissionen gemacht und diesmal hat sich fast jede Nebenmission gelohnt. Es gibt natürlich noch die Neben-neben Missionen xD die sind finde ich komplett unnötig und erinnern eher an Ubisoft Games. Das Kampfssystem macht durch die Synchrofähigkeiten bisschen mehr Spaß aber auch hier ist es eher das optische was geil ist und für mich mehr als genug den Zweck erfüllt. Die Welt ist einfach nur schön. Man erlebt jegliche Emotionen in intesivster Form und die Momente bleiben im Gedächtnis und im Herzen. Die Charaktere, Die Orte, die unglaublich gute Synchronstimmen, die obszön brutal uncensored geile Musik. Fast alle stimmt hier in dem Teil, außer paar Kleinigkeiten die für mich bei dem Gesamtbild nicht existieren. Für Leute die wie ich die Nostalgie Brille anhaben, werden zu 200% Spaß haben, außer ihr habt Final Fantasy damals nur wegen dem Kampfsystem geliebt aber ich finde beide unnötig und bin eher Fraktion Witcher xD. Vielen dank für dieses Meisterwerk <3

Comentario:
So much of a downgrade from Remake, did Ubisoft make this?

When you are doing the actual story the music, characters and visuals are great. I like the relationships that build between your characters and am personally fond of some stupid campiness every now and then to break up the serious tone.

It’s a shame however that the story only accounts for around 20% of the playtime. The rest of the time you are spent doing exceptionally dull fetch quests in an essentially empty open world where every single time you do anything the game stops to tell you that you’ve done something and if you’re lucky Chadley will call you to say nothing at you for 30 seconds. They added climbing into the game which is completely pointless and extremely slow. In an area where you are expected to spend tens of hours wandering around collecting things what you don’t need on top of that is encounters with enemies that are extremely annoying to fight. There are so many that are flying (which limits who can hit them), other stay underground and rely on you parrying them to get them up but then they don’t attack the player character like all other enemies do so you just spend 2 minutes waiting for them to attack you.

That wouldn’t be so bad if it weren’t for the fact that the dull open world is substantially more fun than the no less than 30 minigames they have jammed in which are almost exclusively seem to have been added to make you hate the game as much as possible. Most of them are mandatory (to at least the lowest level) and with the exception of literally a couple of them they are equal parts janky, frustrating and poorly designed. Sure you don’t have to get a rank 1 score on them to continue the story (unless you want the platinum), gamers love getting the worst acceptable score on a minigame and moving on though right? Don't even get me started on the piano which is so intolerable that I had to write a python script to do it for me.

The game forces specific party combinations on you quite often and offers no quick way to swap their materia over leaving you sitting on the “all equipped materia” screen manually swapping each and every piece of materia over, the 1997 original let you transfer all materia at once so going backwards there too. Even pressing buttons or pulling levers takes forever as you have to hold the controller button even though the character is not even trying to do anything they are literally just waiting until the hold is over and the pulling the level as normal. Overall the game just feels like a committee was put together to work out how they can make every single thing you do in the game take as long as humanly possible so they can take a 20h game and make it 100h.

Runs like ass in graphics mode and to make performance mode not a blurry 480p mess you have to set your PS5 to 1440p and then rely on your TVs AI upscaler to make it look tolerable. You cant have a fast pace combat game and lock it at 30 fps, it just looks awful, motion blur can help hide it but this game doesn’t have that either.

I’m still going to platinum it because I have platinumed the entirety of the Final Fantasy back catalogue but unlike the Remake which had frustrating moments but was for the most part a good time, after 40h so far in this game I’ve enjoyed maybe 5h at  a push, I’m on chapter 9 and have heard it gets worse later in the game too so I look forward to doing that twice as hard mode is locked behind completing the game. 

In conclusion, I’m very disappointed, this game feels like work, I play it because I want to platinum it not because I’m enjoying it, I don’t look forward to playing it, I push through in the hopes that I get 30 minutes of good game at some point in my session.

I'm starting to think I'm the problem these days when I see a flood of 10/10 reviews praising the exact things I hate and see as completely contrived padding. Are people googling a list of things that they are supposed to enjoy from game studios websites and then internalizing those or something? It feels absolutely baffling to me that any sane person could say this game is better than Remake. I stopped listening to official reviews a while back because they often deliberately ignore performance issues and bad things about the game, I've been burnt too many times. Now I cant even get an idea if the game is good from the general consensus of the people that play it as for the most part people don't seem to recognize bad game design even when its force fed to them.

Comentario:
This game is everything you'd want in a final fantasy 7 remake, but they fail to deliver on the most important story points. There is a return of plot ghosts from remake, but it seems someone told them to slow it down with these convoluted story elements; so instead of abandoning them, they pursue a new plot with them, at the same time as being nearly one-to-one with the old story; the parallel stories end up interfering and causing a profoundly disappointing ending.

The gameplay is top notch, the mini quests are great, the open world is great, and the writing for the smaller stories are fantastic; it is such a shame they couldn't get whoever wrote those stories to do the main plot.

Comentario:
オープンワールドRPGの最高傑作であり、この世のほとんどのRPGを凌駕するクオリティにただただ脱帽するばかり。
オリジナルのFFVIIすら凌いでいる。
コピペ1つすらない都市の建造物に内装、各オブジェクトの作り込みと、単に美しいグラフィックだけではない凄さがそこにある。
まるで自分が本当にそこに存在していて、クラウド達と共に旅をしているような感覚だ。
NPCに関してはスカイリムほどプレイヤーが干渉できるものではないが、その分状況によってNPC同士の会話に変化が見られるので彼らを観察しているだけでも飽きない。
それはちょっと物語が進行するだけでまるで変わる。
なので、一度訪れた町を再び訪れる楽しみすらあるのだ。
私はアクション性には興味がない。
最低限のアクションでシームレスに戦闘の臨場感を感じることができればそれでいい。
スカイリムくらいのアクション性で十分だ。
なのでここには敢えて触れない。
RPGとして非常にクオリティが高いことに驚愕したということだ。
主人公に人格のあるRPGは自由度が低い傾向があるが、FFVIIリバースは見事にこれを解決している。
フィールドの広大さや場所によってガラっと変わる風景の他にも豊富なサブクエストやゴールドソーサーでの息抜きなど、これら全てがJRPGである前に、RPGそのものであることを再認識させてくれる。
本当に素晴らしい。

Comentario:
Final Fantasy VII Rebirth is a masterpiece that beautifully melds nostalgia with modernity. As a long-time fan of the original, I was skeptical about how a remake could live up to such a legendary title, but Square Enix has outdone themselves. The graphics are breathtaking, with environments so lush and detailed that they feel alive. Voice acting is top-notch, giving new depth to beloved **** combat system is a perfect blend of action and strategy, making battles thrilling yet cerebral. The addition of synergy skills and the revamped materia system add layers of depth to combat that were unimagined in the original. The storyline, while faithful to the source material, introduces new twists and deeper character development, making the journey feel fresh even to veterans of the original game.Exploring the world beyond Midgar has been an absolute joy. Each region is unique, filled with secrets and stories that enrich the overarching narrative. The game's pacing is excellent, balancing intense action sequences with quiet moments of character interaction and exploration.What sets Final Fantasy VII Rebirth apart is its ability to evoke a wide range of emotions. I've laughed, cried, and felt the thrill of adventure alongside Cloud and his companions. This game is not just a trip down memory lane; it's an entirely new experience that respects its roots while forging ahead into uncharted **** conclusion, Final Fantasy VII Rebirth is not just a game; it's a monumental achievement in storytelling and game design. It's a journey worth taking, whether you're a fan of the original or new to the series. A solid 10/10 for me.

Comentario:
Just wow. I know there is a lot of people out there upset that the story is different that the original game. Which I understand. But coming from someone who is rather new to these games.. I thought it was an incredible journey. I did play Remake and Rebirth back to back. Which I strongly believe helped me be attached to the story and characters a lot more. So my biggest recommendation is to play these games back to back or just to thave a strong understanding of the events in FF7 Remake. 

Truthfully, would of given it a 9.5 (but Metacritic doesn't allow for .5 points) as the performance isn't the greatest.  But to me.. that really didn't take away at how good the game was. There was slight pacing issues but (without spoiling what the game filled these parts with) I ended up enjoying this "side" stuff the more I accepted what the devs were trying to offer us. All I can say was more options to have more fun in different ways instead of just always needing to fight things. (Tough to convey my thoughts on that without spoiling)

But all and all.. if someone is considering embarking this FF7 Remake/Rebirth journey.. and are on the fence because some YouTube reviewers are upset about the story.. just tune that out and make your own decision. Don't let the internet tell you what to think. You might play it andend up agreeing with what they said (which is perfectly fine) but you might play it and realize you want to spend hours and hours in this world.

Now I have to reconsider my hierarchy of games I've played. This fits somewhere at the top (I can already feel haters eyes roll back while reading this) But this was what I personally want out ****. Not a FF game.. just a game in general.

Comentario:
The game is great when it sticks to the basics. The combat is fantastic, the character development and world building is good, some of the minigames are awesome (chocobo racing, piano, queens blood are my favourites). 

What lets the whole thing down is the overdone extras. So many unnecessary stops and starts and hand-holding (world intel, CHAD, unnecessarily slow cutscene like sequences where you walk slowly and press L2/R2) as well as an overcomplicated story and way, way too many minigames. It just felt like a chore to get through.

So while there's a 20 hour gem **** hidden in here, you're forced to sift through 20 hours of rubbish to get to it, and for that I give a 7/10.

Comentario: Way too many mini-games tied to so many quests.  I dont mind minigames when they're isolated from sidequests or mainquests- something you know you're going to do before you do it, but this game literally has over half of all sidequests, often with story elements and good gear, tied to some annoying, frustrating mini game.  Why not do it like the Yakuza games where you KNOW when you're doing a mini game or not?  Most of the combat revolves around fighting in the open world, few side quests, and main quests, and over half are some nonsense gimmicky mini game.  Other than that the combat itself is better, the bond quests are great (save the forced mini games), and the story is pretty good.  Performance mode needs to be cleaned up as well.  Overall a bit disappointing.

Comentario: Story is convoluted, the characters are just one liners with very little substance. Most of the dialogue makes no sense. Combat is cheesy and unfair, with unblockable and undodgable attacks. You have to keep an eye on too many things on screen while fighting, the hybrid combat doesnt work well at all. Exploration is a farse. You are basically ticking off a checkbox just like Ubisoft games. Its run to this location to the next with no interesting things inbetween, with no interesting movement mechanic either. Everything you do while exploring is a puzzle, the very nature of exploring in this game is a puzzle, each zone after the other adds a new gimick that you need to use to progress through the zone like a puzzle in a level, its not exploration it ****. The game is bloated with minigames that are overly frustrating, and seem to only be there to elongate the game. You spend more time trying to complete the minigames than actually playing the game. Only good thing is the graphics. Arguebly the easiest thing to get right.

Comentario:
After 99 hours of game time I'm just coming here to give my feedback in hopes you won't read some trolls review and pass on giving this experience a try! 5,000 words won't be enough to portray my full feelings and reactions behind the game so I'm going to be very short and to the point. Final Fantasy 7 Rebirth is up there in a very prestigious tier of video games setting the absolute highest mark for their genre such as Elden Ring, Baldurs Gate 3, and now this game. This is an absolute masterclass in everything JRPG related. Character, design, cutscene, battles, mini-games, emotion, story, worlds, the different ways you traverse the lands. It's so incredibly well done and an absolutely amazing and wild ride, I hope you give it a try and enjoy it even partially as much as I did!

I would agree that maybe they didn't need to go that hard on mini-games, and that some side-quests are very tedious for the sake of pleasing your comrades and growing your relationship with them. But you can skip these things, and for those simply wanting a story experience you can throw it on easy and just cruise through and enjoy one of the greatest gaming stories ever portrayed!!

Comentario:
C'est une ode, un hommage à son grand frére. 
Cette pléthore de mini jeu est l'essence même de FFVII, et la plupart sont skipable.

Comentario:
神ゲー。
リメイクの時点でも素晴らしいゲームだったが、今作では更にパワーアップ。
戦闘はより複雑に面白くなり、アクションの占める割合が上がった。特にジャスガの実装などは素晴らしい。
また、たくさんのミニゲームは素晴らしいものが多く、冒険の息抜きとしてとても楽しめる。ただ数が多い分全てが面白いというわけではないし、人によって合う合わないはあるだろう。
探索についてだが、マップの広さや、オブジェクトが目に楽しいということなど、素晴らしい面も多いが、マッピングされない探索要素が非常に少なく、どのような報酬があるのだろうかというワクワク感を持って探索することが難しい。与えられる報酬が分かりきっているのは少し残念だ。また、高低差がある地形でどこから登れるかが定かではない、などの不便さもある。しかし総合的に見てとても楽しい体験であることは間違いない。
グラフィックについては言うことがないだろう。
ストーリーについては好みの分かれるところもあるだろうが、私にはとても素晴らしく思えた。大筋のストーリーだけではなく、道中での会話やサブクエストでの台詞回しがとても良くて、笑えたり、感動できたりとしっかりとこちらの感情を動かしてくれて一言たりとも聞き流すことはできなかった。
欠点がないわけではないが(というかそんなゲームは存在しない)、私が今までやってきた全てのゲームの中で最も素晴らしいゲームであると言える。満点。

Comentario:
Historia:
La historia de Final Fantasy VII Rebirth logra capturar la esencia del juego original de manera magistral. Los momentos icónicos, los personajes entrañables y la trama épica mantienen esa esencia y añadiendo algunas escenas para profundizar en ciertos tramos de la historia para conseguir cohesión y compresión de la misma. Para los fanáticos del título original, esta fidelidad es un verdadero regalo. La nostalgia se mezcla con la emoción de experimentar la historia desde una nueva perspectiva.

Puntos Positivos

1. Combate Divertido y Profundo:
El sistema de combate es uno de los puntos más destacados de Rebirth. La combinación de acción en tiempo real con elementos estratégicos pillados del sistema classico por turnos es puto increible! La posibilidad de cambiar entre personajes y utilizar habilidades sincronizadas entre ellos agrega mucha profundidad al combate y hace que cada batalla se sienta dinámica y satisfactoria.

2. Música: 
La banda sonora merece una ovación de pie. Las composiciones musicales son emotivas y épicas. Desde los temas clásicos hasta las reinterpretaciones de los mismos, cada nota está cuidadosamente diseñada para sumergir al jugador en el mundo del juego. Es un verdadero deleite para los oídos.

3. Apartado Artístico y Visual
Los gráficos y el diseño artístico son impresionantes. Los entornos, los personajes y los efectos visuales están meticulosamente detallados. Cada escenario es una obra de arte. Rebirth demuestra cómo la tecnología actual puede dar nueva vida a un clásico.

Puntos Negativos:

1. Contenido Secundario y Ritmo de la Historia:
Si bien el contenido secundario es opcional, algunos jugadores pueden sentir que distrae del ritmo principal de la historia. Es importante matizar que esta es una elección personal. Si decides explorar las misiones secundarias y realizar todo el contenido de cada zona nueva antes de ir a la siguiente, es algo que es inevitable.

2. Modo Rendimiento en PlayStation 5
El modo rendimiento en la versión de PlayStation 5 necesita un poco más de pulido. Aunque es funcional, algunos jugadores pueden notar pequeños problemas de borrosidad en dicho modo. Sin embargo, esto no afecta significativamente la experiencia general y va a 60 FPS muy estables.

Comentario:
I have played the Orginal Final Fantasy on NIntendo back in 1987!!  I played virtually all of them but not cleared them all because some are amazing and some are not!   

Final Fantasy Remake 7 (part 1) was good but not great!  It was missing something and I couldn't put my finger on it until i played Rebirth!!  I was worried 7 Rebirth would follow and have same or similar misteps of 7 remake!   

I have two criticism about the game - 1) You can not fast travel once you move to the next geographic area unless you complete some side quest.   2) Final end bosses I spend too much time healing my main character or other party members rather than focus on fighting - I wish there was a way to automatically heal after certain %.  

I would like to say that Rebirth has Brought my love for Final Fantasy back!  This is what made Final Fantasy fans remembered what made this series and franchise great!  It took over 20yrs to come to this point!   

I am sad because other Final Fantasy fan and players started to give up on this series!!!!  But I want to rest ASSURRE every Final Fantasy player who grew up playing 6 (snes3) to 7 on Playstation to 9 and 10 in the series will fall in LOVE as they did as a child with their love and passion of Final Fantasy games!!!   

Rebirth is greatest Final Fatnasy Game!!  It has now beaten my most favorite 6 Snes 3!!  Because I feel the heart and soul for this cast of characters i feel has brought to life has left an impact!  The music, gameplay, story, the world is absolutely amazing!  10/10!!  Masterpiece! 

BRAVO, Bravo!!!

Comentario:
FF7 Rebirth is everything and much more than I could have wished for in this beautiful Remake of my all time favorite game.
I really like everything about this game. Usually I get bored with open worlds because they feel too overwhelming and repetitive. Not in this game. Square Enix managed to find the perfect balance with the open areas and the linear story elements.
The best thing is that they found a way to maintain the charme of the original while putting it in a modern scenery. Especially the minigames. They feel like in 1997 but also have a modern touch and some of them are quite challenging. Queens Blood is a nice addition to that.
Story and Soundtrack are imo still the best in the history of video games. It is a must buy for every FF7 or JRPG fan.. also for every other ps5 owner. :)
Only downside for me is that the hard mode only unlocks after the first playthrough. While I totally love this game and put already 60hours in it in the first week after release, I, and I guess many others just dont have the time to play such huge games again. Would have loved to go directly into hard mode.

Comentario:
Once you get yourself past the hype and the legacy of the franchise and really sit down with this title and be honest, you'll realize this is a middling bordering on boring experience from start to finish.

Trying to jam a 25 year old system into modern mechs while simultaneously trying to weave new idea into a package makes for an unbalanced combat experience bordering on laughably bad. If another game came out employing this system and it wasn't a legacy franchise most of these 10's here would be 0's and 1's.

Balance, just like the first one is broken to all hell. Normal is so unbalanced and overtooled that all it really brings is frustration and slowed progress because every fight becomes a chore. Easy, is braindead but at least the combat feel fun. Dynamic is just broken. It doesn't pace you, it instead wildly fluctuates between being a simple fight, to just getting obliterated by world trash mobs for no good reasons. This isn't a bug, Square's dev teams (all of them, and I play a fair amount of ff14) are incapable of properly balancing their content. They just whiplash between one extreme to the other. It's awful and drags what could be masterpieces into this mind numbing and frustration inducing slog.

Visually it looks like every other modern AAA Square game, not a bad a thing. Music is top notch as always, and while the main cast voice acting is adequate (it's not great at least the English VO), the NPC deliverers are just cringe worthy.

The models look great except why Aerith and Tifa have a constant vapid dead eye, smooth brain reaction to everything is beyond me. I don't expect strong female leads to be hardasses to show strength, but doe-eyed dumbasses isn't the way to go.

And like every Square title, the story and what it's trying to say is a garbled mess written by people that should be retired from content design in gaming by now. I'm not kidding when I say the leads at Square should all be gone from their positions and fresh new eyes be brought in, and not one's that are connected to these people in any way. 

Like Remake, this is a movie with interaction from people dotted in. Square doesn't really want to make games, they desperately want to make movies, and now two games have proved me correct. If you bought the first one, you'll buy this. Where Remake had this focused narrative and pace, Rebirth throws all that away for a nominally empty open world map full of generic collectibles that appeal to nothing more than ticking off the grind/collector box expected in RPG's.

The greater debate being had right now is, FF16 or FF7Rebirth, which is superior; and it's no contest in terms of what I want from my games. You give me FF16, you give me that model at minimum. You evolve from that game and you never look back. You kill this jank combat model in the ff7 remakes in fire and you never do it again.

*Update: Knocking this down to a 0 for the worst designed minigames in the history of video games and EVERYTHING IS A GODDAMN MINIGAME. Absolutely wrecks the experience beyond repair. 100% done with the series. I will not be back for the last section.

I also do not for the life of me understand Square spends literal years creating dozens upon dozens of hours of unlockables and powerful weapons and gear, only to lock them behind some of the most poor padding content and difficulty levels, or only acquirable AFTER BEATING THE GAME! Sheer madness.

Comentario:
It's an enjoyable romp that 30% reminds you of the original, 30% new stuff and 40% mini games and fluff. Wanna pick 3 mushrooms, that's a mini game. There is a LOT of mini games... none of them are good. There's also a card game, don't worry i did the tournament and beat them all and i still have no idea how to play the game. Knowing doesn't make any difference.

Graphically it's great. It looks stunning and the cutscenes are well done, voice acting is a little wayward you will wish a certain AI female would shut up. A lot. as she continues talking. constantly. during fights which require you to get certain marks. 

Story wise, it loosely follows the adventures of FF7 from the outskirts of midgar throughout golden saucer and beyond into cosmo canyon. Yes that part is in it. Yes it remains pretty much the same outcome.  Cloud does go a lot more crazy in sections so unlike the original when he completely breaks down into wheelchair cloud it won't come as any surprise. to anyone.

Yes you can ride the buggy, even play around with the aircraft... combat is the same as the first remake, it's workable. but not brilliant.

In fact bar the graphics it's a pretty average game all around. I'm still surprised it's the 7th march and a lot of trophies i just got are still well below the 5% mark. The game needs some refinement, after doing the fort condor i recommend doing the "hard" version straight after because it's easier than all the previous rounds altogether.

To the vets who played the original some of the stuff does leave a nasty taste in the mouth, especially during the needless beachwear acquisition, and when you think it's over you gotta do it again for another of the sexes. There's a lot, that's just not fun. It's fluff. Filler. that isn't really needed. 

Hey do you wanna collect towers, and explore the map doing all the stuff on it like assassins creed and it's ilk, well you're in luck. It's here. AGAIN like every other game under the sun. Travelling around is less fun than spiderman 2 though So yay, that's what we all wanted. 

And obviously there's a lot you can't do until you do certain things, meet certain objectives yadda yadda. Again. Average. In my head the graphics and art style wants me to push it into 7 or 8. (play fort condor with their original designs in proper 3D - that's the remake i wanted).

But the thought of playing it again.... no. it's a once, do as much as you can ... and never play it again. ever. Like the first remake.

And for that reason, it remains a 6... and far below the original. A lot needs improved for the last outing. And i personally don't think they can do it.

Comentario:
El mejor Final Fantasy de los últimos años. Mantiene el interés a pesar de que ya conozcas la historia, y termina por generarte las mismas sensaciones que con el original. Es divertido de principio a Fin. Sus personajes están perfectamente bien construidos, si ya en el juego de 1997 terminabas encariñándote con cada uno de ellos, en Revirth todo se duplica. es un JRPG clásico en todos los sentidos, con sus cosas buenas y malas, pero si eres fan del genero sabrás entenderlo.
Es muy divertido y adictivo, excelentes gráficos y banda sonora, tiene algunos pequeños problemas que seguramente se van a ir resolviendo con futuras actualizaciones, pero ninguno de ellos te rompe la experiencia de juego.

Comentario: HUGE downgrade from Remake. The last 3  chapters are phenomenal, why couldn't Square have made the whole game like that?! Game is 20-30 hours but with the filler/open world bloat it could take upwards of 100 hours. Great graphics, good story, superb animations but many, MANY issues. Great until you hit Gongaga and then it falls apart because the open world garbage starts getting old and the focused narrative disappears until the last few chapters. 65+ Hours so it could FORCE me on a date with a f***** DOG. How about this Squeenix: let the player choose. What a novel concept! Has anyone in this hair-brained studio played a video game in the last 20 years? Romance "system" is so vague and poorly developed it REQUIRES a detailed external guide to get the outcome you want. Takes the ROLE PLAYING out of your RPG. No invert aim for shooting/flying sections, no option to heal during said sections using garbage controls. No block cancelling + stun-locking for so long you could get up and make coffee (not even joking here). Mini-games galore! All of them frustrating with controls so bad they feel like they're designed to be torture implements in Hell itself. Pointless open world filler plus Chadley is a huge negative. Comically difficult combat that's so poorly balanced it could be in a FromSoft game. QA was on vacation for most of the game. Last few chapters tighten up and it feels like a proper RPG again, essentially redeeming the garbage parts in the open world. Remake is the better game. Needs patches, balancing and otherwise.

Comentario:
If you don't play the second playthrough, and don't do a lot of the sidequests, then it's 9. But if you are somewhat a trophy hunter then you are doomed.

While clearing out the the maps, map traversal was so bad on Gongaga, slightly better but also bad on Corel. It seems like an open-world, you may reach a point with many routes. Comentario:
1. The world-building is exceptionally well done, with each character intricately developed through a rich array of subplots, making them vivid and lifelike.
2. As an open-world game, the level of exploration and the richness of side activities are astonishing, offering remarkable replay value.
3. While the game is driven by its narrative, the plot often progresses at a sluggish pace. Much of the time is spent on character development rather than advancing the storyline significantly. Additionally, the introduction of some characters not present in the original work deviates the plot from its original trajectory, thus diminishing the epic feel of the narrative that the original source material possessed.

Comentario: Final Fantasy XV was my very first Final Fantasy game. Because of that I decided to give REMAKE a shot and enjoyed it more than XV. I've been anticipating REBIRTH ever since it was announced as a Remake trilogy and the wait was worth it! I absolutely hated the thought of having to go to bed because I didn't want to stop playing it. I'm only 20 hours in the game (currently chapter 6, but a lot of side quests and exploring) and I've been enjoying every minute of it. The characters make me invested and the story is keeping me engaged and interested. I haven't noticed much negatives about the game (still not halfway through the story), but If I did my only complaints would be the world intensive. As a completionist I want to complete all side quests in every region, but it does take you away from the main story and even though others say to mainline the story and not do all the side quests at once, I just can't help it. Another annoyance are some of the mini games. There's a LOT of them and majority of them are helluv fun, some are tedious and actually pretty difficult. Like Queen's Blood in my opinion has potential, but was pretty annoying to play especially Fort Condor mini game. All in all, it's one of the best Final Fantasy games I've played and something I don't want to put down until I complete it all.

Comentario:
I was torn between giving this a 9 or a 10, but because of all the fan service I do believe it deserves a 10. 

There is just so much to love about this remake of final fantasy 7. When it was initially announced that they were going to break FF7 into three games, many people were skeptical. In my opinion, Square has proven all of these skeptics wrong.

Rebirth continues to expand on FF7 universe. It takes fond childhood memories that were vague and unrefined and makes them into truly wonderful moments. I hope people feel how I feel playing this game. Its like childhood in a bottle.

Not only does Rebirth expand on these wonderful memories, but it also successfully able to interject new ideas into the story without ruining what made the original game so special. 

The combat overall feels much better than the first game. There is more of a reason to switch between characters. You will build your synergy bar for every ATP action the character takes. In the first game I played cloud about 90% of the time. In Rebirth its probably about 60%, which feels about right. 

Limit breaks also feel better. I'm triggering these more often and I'm triggering them sometimes multiple per fight. While the breaking mechanic is relatively the same as the first game, pressuring and staggering enemies seems a bit easier. This may just be as a result of being more familiar with the combat system. 

I'm also not staying in punisher stance the entire time as Cloud. Operator mode feels MUCH better. They gave cloud a ranged attack after dodging in operator mode, and this makes Cloud much more seamless. They added an ability to fills the ATB gauge and switches your stances, further making this feel a bit better. However, it's still not quite there. I'm staying in Operator far more than punisher, and often only switching to punisher for countering. Stance dancing really isn't a thing still. You will likely be in one stance or another depending on the fight. I hope they can nail this one down for the third game and make switching between operator and punisher feel truly seamless. 

Rebirth also feels less like an RPG than the first game did. They removed the weapon tree bubbles and added in a very simplistic weapon upgrade system. I can't say I'm a fan here. I know not everyone likes talent trees, but I would love to see something similar in the third game. As it stands right now, it feels far too shallow. I know the original FF7 didn't have a ton of customization here, but I would personally like to see more with remake.

Most fights also still far too fast. Most fights don't require you to switch between character. Most fights you won't stagger enemies or perform a limit break. Most fights you won't even need to cast a spell. This is the same problem I had with the first game. Give me a hard mode right off the bat. I love the idea of adding a harder difficulty after you beat the game. The game is just too easy in general, give the player the option. You have a terrific combat system and I feel like you only get to truly see the potential in a handful of fights throughout the game.

Comentario: The original concept has evolved into something new entirely, no words of how much more depth the game has gained since the conception of this new remake trilogy. In fact I think is wrong to call these games a remake, because they are actually sequels to the magnificent original. Rebirth offers so much more than the first game in this new trilogy, it comes with so much content to satisfy the most demanding gamers but also is totally optional. A player can go straight to the next mainline story mission without bothering with much else or for the completionist it provides plenty of locations to visit, tons of surprises, mini games and side missions with meaningful content. The combat was great from Remake but Square Enix even found a way to make it better, synergies were a perfect addition to action scenes and to thrilling experiences facing powerful bosses. This game surpassed all my expectations and as a long time fan of the series and also an RPG nut there could not be any other score for me than perfect.

Comentario:
If you like Final Fantasy 11-16, that's okay. I have nothing against you. They were all decent to good games. But, Square hasn't made a great JRPG in a long, long time (since FF10). I really enjoyed Remake, but Rebirth is finally the game I think Square has been trying to make since they wanted to integrate Western RPG's into their formula. 

The transversal isn't great and the turning of the camera can be a little blurry in graphics mode. Those are the only "bad" things about this game. 

The mini-games are great
The side quests are awesome (not witcher 3 level, but much better than Assassin's Creed)
The world they've created feels wondrous to be a part of
They've got a little crafting system that I really dig

But, what I like most is how the party is always around. Your teammates are always being included in conversation and you can switch party member groups by simply pressing the L1 button. Every developer should take note on this specifically because it truly is the best way to have parties interact with each other. Yes, even better than Dragon Age Origins. Having the team always together creates a unique cohesiveness that is beautiful to be a part of. 

My expectations were high, and they were surpassed. That never happens to me. Bravo Square, Bravo

PS: I will be keeping an eye on Hamaguchi, the Director. He said a lot of great things in his interviews, and most importantly, he delivered

Comentario: Please just write a simple ending to the last game . :( I walked into this game, an already massive Remake and OG fan. I was 100% confident even before playing Rebirth I was going to score it a 10. After an incredible first few chapters, the larger middle part of this game caused me to begin missing the linear, mission driven narrative of Remake. The story bits were indeed compelling and I had become even more invested in the characters, but the narrative felt disjointed with arguably “poor padding to story ratio.” I continued to feel this way, and almost even lost it with that Shani chocobo girl (mini games was fun, dialogue was not), until the final chapters when I was finally drawn back into a more consistent narrative. -albeit earned with tedious back to back battles at the end. And then the end happened, and to my surprise, it didn’t leave me with the same hunger for the next game that Remake left me with. And bam, there's no way I could give this game a 10, despite its unparalleled soundtrack, battle system, and voice acting. Clocking in at 60 hours to beat the main story, I still had tons to discover. It’s at this point I began to recognize the brilliance of this game. Jumping to different chapters, watching old cutscenes, exploring more side quests (several are great in quality, others, are mediocre), and learning how many things I missed in my initial play through all brought to light just how much this motley crew had impacted me and how much more time I wanted to spend with them. I’ve only had this game for 1 week and somehow this game and its character moments already feel nostalgic, more so than any game I’ve played. (make sure to watch all the dates btw!) I want to hang with this crew so bad. This game definitely has flaws, some that I’d welcome minor changes to. (Hojo and Aerith on the beach, the gunmen with Sephiroth in the Nibelheim flashback, and the presentation of the ending. The ending isn’t terrible, and I welcome the concepts, just maybe fix the execution to focus more on the characters rather than building the exposition. Also Mai’s and Chadley’s intel commentary… and again the overall pacing) There are times when you question why they made certain decisions, including the ending or forcing you to play as certain characters, however, in each case I can think of legitimately positive reasons they made such decisions, despite people griping over them. Rebirth offers a somewhat surprising plethora of options to manipulate gameplay to your liking, and I’m ready to turn off the mini map to finish authentically exploring the Rebirth world. The boss battles are fun and sometimes require strategy and serious skill. Queen's Blood is fantastic! The variety of to-dos is endless. And Cloud's character development at the end kicks you to the floor and spits on your face with vigor. I felt like I was carrying tons of heavy energy at the end. (in a good way) Overall, I think Rebirth gives me massive insight into how the directors plan to take care of the final installment, and I’m not worried one bit. This remake series pays an exceptional tribute to the original and is the farthest thing from a cash grab. The FF VII Remake series will likely conclude as my favorite series of all time with Rebirth being an in-kweh-dible game I already want to get all my friends hooked on. :)

Comentario: This game is a steaming pile of garbage. The gameplay is boring and repetitive. When I pay $70, I expect a combat system with depth and detail. All the developers did in this game is put pretty lights during every move, to give players the illusion that the game is fun. None of that is fun for me. The plants don't react to your movement. The game looks very blurry in performance mode. Ever wondered why you've been looked down upon for playing video games? Look no further than the Final Fantasy series. I mean there are plenty of reasons why people think you're a loser for playing video games, but the FF series is a perfect example for this perception. The "dun dun dun dun" melodic voice these characters make are cringeworthy. It's reasons like this why it's embarrassing to be a gamer. There were textures in this game that made me want to puke. The lighting is horrendous. There were sections in this game where the lighting was nonexistent. Thanks to the awful lighting and textures, there are sections in this game that look downright terrible. I've noticed this problem when you are particularly in the shades, it literally looks like the GTA 6 pre-alpha leaks. ● I have not watched or read any of the critic reviews, but I guarantee you the journalists are heavily praising the Queen's Blood card minigame, to the point that they are suggesting it should have its own standalone game. They said the same thing about Gwent and it flopped hard. Just goes to show how out of touch these critics are. These critics are so predictable, just like these nerdy toy-collecting millennials. If I see a millennial (or early zoomer as in 97) with a room full of toys talking about video games, then I already know what is about to come out of that person's inconsistent mouth. Just like Gwent, the characters do not pick up the cards in real-time. Are you freaking kidding me? If RDR1 on PS3 has the characters holding the cards in poker, that means there is literally no excuse for not adding real-time card holding in this $70 PS5 game. The developers were too cheap and lazy to animate the characters holding the cards. And speaking of RDR, the Chocobo riding mechanics lack detail. I want the Chocobos to have RDR2 physics-based horse riding mechanics where you can collide your mount against obstacles or make them trip and fall against specific surfaces. ● There is no multiplayer. So once you beat the story, there is literally not a reason to play this game again. Charging $70 for a game with no replay value is cash grab. The characters can magically run over rocky environments without any changes in the momentum, it makes the game look like shovelware. In GTA V, the momentum of your player changes if you run over rocky obstacles or steep hills. The player can even lose balance and fall on these obstacles. Keep in mind that GTA V is a game originally built for PS3 and 360. Now I understand why some developers don't want to add the trip and fall mechanics to their games, but there isn't a single freaking excuse why the greedy developers can't make momentum or animation changes when traversing over certain surfaces. This is a $70 PS5 game, so I expect top-notch AAA quality. The physics are a joke. The segway lacks collision physics. Boss fights are trash. The story is horrible. The developers bragged about all the minigames, but they all lack quality. A building magically appears and reappears in the soccer minigame. I don't recommend this game at all.

Comentario: This game is a masterful remake, setting new standards for the genre. With mature storytelling and nuanced character development, it offers an immersive experience. Side quests are engaging, deepening player-character connections without feeling tedious. Combat is enhanced, introducing systems that add tactical depth and maintain challenge. The open-world is thoughtfully designed, making exploration rewarding. This game is not just a tribute to its legendary predecessor but a standout title in its own right, blending heartfelt emotion, strategic gameplay, and captivating moments. A true spectacle in the gaming world, it’s a must-play for fans and newcomers alike.

Comentario:
FFVII Rebirth consigue transmitir lo que en su día los FF originales de Squaresoft transmitieron en su momento, con una historia épica, emotiva con varios momentos hilarantes. Un mundo abierto que sin ser innovador, consigue ser adictivo gracias a sus múltiples tareas secundarias, repartidas por la inmensa Gaia. Un apartado sonoro increíble, de lo mejorcito que se ha escuchado en muchísimo tiempo en el género.
Si es verdad que hay un par de cosas que no están bien, cómo el modo rendimiento (aunque pronto lo arreglaran) y algún que otro popeo de texturas tanto en el entorno cómo en algunos personajes(la capa moguri de Yuffie, por ejemplo), aún asíno dejan de ser un par de cosas que no eclipsan los apartados brillantes de este título. Sin duda, FFVII Rebirth se convierte por motivos propios, en un clásico atemporal en la industria, consolidándose cómo uno de los mejores JRPG de la década y en uno de los mejores FF de la historia.
Comentario_Limpo: vii rebirth manages convey original squaresoft ff transmitted time epic story emotional several hilarious moments open world without innovative manages addictive thanks multiple secondary task distributed immense gain incredible sound section best heard lot time genre true couple thing well performance mode even soon fix texture pope environment character suffix mourn layer exampleeven cease couple thing eclipse brilliant section titleundoubtedly vii rebirth becomes reason timeless classic industry consolidating one best rpg decade one best ff history

Comentario:
Let me preface this by saying I absolutely loved Remake, so much so that I played it four times total. Normal and Hard Mode on PS4, and then when Intergrade came I did it all again on Normal and Hard for both base game and the Intergrade episode. 

I have not enjoyed my experience in playing Rebirth so far. It has been very mixed. I am trying to stay engaged knowing that I love the characters and the story of the Final Fantasy 7 Compilation. But after 60 hours of ploughing through this game, I finally hit my breaking point with it upon attempting to do yet another minigame to unlock faster travel in the Nibel Region. 

It feels like there was very little quality assurance on this game, maybe it’ll improve with feedback and patching over the coming months but I am unlikely to consider putting more time into this game going forward. 

I really wanted to love Rebirth. It’s gorgeous, the map is huge and the nitpicks with graphics are overkill; some claiming it looks like a PlayStation 3 era game which is entirely wrong. Ultimately my frustrations with Rebirth are enough that I cannot bring myself to complete it anymore. 

Let’s start with the changes to the Combat System. The addition of Synergy Abilities is really cool, adds an extra dynamic layer to the already excellent system introduced in Remake. The addition of Elemental Abilities that do not require MP is a welcome change given how much you had to ration MP in Remake, particularly on Hard Mode. Synergy Skills on the other hand, are obtuse and interrupt the flow of combat. In Remake, the player could enter the Command Menu and issue commands to party members (such as a Cure spell) while retaining Block during combat - this has been removed in Rebirth and combat is absolutely worse for it. 

The world map is beautiful, and I want to have fun exploring and discovering the various aspects of the world and feel the love that developers poured into its creation. However there are many ‘obstacles’ that make little sense, make traversal obtuse, and our mount companions struggle with the terrain more than they canonically should. Additionally, the game treats players like they’re too dumb to discover the map by having visual cues that feel more like harassment than anything else, we shouldn’t need all of these cues and there are definitely alternative cues that could’ve been used that would’ve felt augmentative versus reductive. Also a particular NPC from Remake who had a minor role has been duplicated, made even more obnoxious and given significantly more screen time which after the first 30 hours of exploration became button mashing through their dialogues to avoid. 

Every single chapter introduces a new control gimmick or minigame, which should be expected as both the original Final Fantasy 7 and Remake have a plethora of these. However, it genuinely feels like quality assurance was non-existent throughout the development of many of these. Some of them are optional, many of them are not. Some of these minigames have counterparts in Remake that were significantly better and have been made worse for some reason in Rebirth. Many of the control schemes for minigames are unintuitive, and there are a lot of time based inputs that seem to be significantly more punishing than you’d expect considering they’re supposed to be fun side content. All of the shooter minigames are fun and flow well; but there is no way to increase the speed of the crosshair, similarly, for the Nibel Region mount quest, you are required to throw items but cannot see the full extent of the area while you attempt to do so. Hitboxes for collisions on some things also seem to be too large. 

Finally, the audio mixing is all over the place even with player intervention via the Audio Settings. Background voices share the speech control rather than being considered SFX, and so when roaming busy locations the sound quickly becomes overwhelming - especially when trying to pay attention to dialogue of an important character that the story wants you to follow. While the OST is fantastic as with Remake, it’s also all over the place and out of nowhere you get really loud tracks playing directly contrasting quieter pieces with little warning. It can be a lot. 

I understand that a lot of Rebirth’s development took place during the Pandemic and so there was a lot of working from home here, but you would expect that as a result, QA would’ve been significantly more involved for this particular title. 

There will be patching to come, I can only hope that there is hope for minigames going forward. But as of right now, I have no personal desire to return to the game regardless of my love for the franchise. 

I did not expect to be as genuinely frustrated from a game that isn’t actively trying to be difficult, and I certainly would not waste $80 on a game I expect to hate in an economy where money continues to grow ever more stretched.

I hope it improves. If so, so will my score.

Comentario:
Decent game with some caveats

First the combat is generally engaging and pretty fun. Bosses are generally fun and challenging, but unlike Remake anything between bosses is just dumb trash enemies that only exist to be pummeled you can just mash square with reckless abandon and the enemies will be helpless. Perhaps this is a result of complaints from Remake but I can’t help but be disappointed with the result. There is an aspect in combat that albeit short lasting is bound to leave some players frustrated. 

I was surprised this carried over from the demo, but in the full game if you switch to a different character and that character is new to you switching to, the game will open up a tutorial every time you pause the game. What is the problem with this you may ask? Well let’s say you are at a section before a boss and you just switched to a character and this tutorial section comes up well you are unable to restart the battle for any reason (mistake, it’s a loosing battle, redo for a mechanic) it will just bring up that tutorial preventing you from restating and resorting to waiting till everyone dies. Utterly perplexing design decisions. 

Let’s move on to some other designs of the game namely that of its open world design. I will not sugar coat it the design is formulaic/generic just about the most boring and laziest way to design an open world game. This isn’t Elden Ring quality of open world it’s a checklist of mind numbingly boring objectives that are the same over and over and over again. The padded out open world filled with objectives and mini-games is tiresome and in conflict with the rest of the game. The game shines at its best where the linear portions of the game happen and falters again when it’s back to open world mediocrity. There are also several perplexing design decisions like making the player sit still unable to move for several seconds after finishing these open world objectives for no reason. 

There is actually something that bothers me and it’s pretty minor but the chocobo sniff and peck for treasure is ill designed. The sniffing takes a long time and sometimes you’ll be sniffing for a while in the same general area moving around only for it to finally ding right beneath the chocobo’s legs. Who designed this? Thankfully it’s a minor aspect of the game. 

As far as visuals prepare to be disappointed while the world is filled with enough assets the textures adorning some of these assets are abysmal that you would think some areas would have looked at home on a PS3 (no I am not being hyperbolic some textures do indeed look that awful it’s not the majority of the stuff but when you do see it it’s hard not to be surprised), both the performance and quality modes showcase blurry visuals that are a downgrade from the previous game even in places where such a thing should have minimal impact like VR combat. Remake looks very crisp in comparison. The lighting implementation is also questionable. This ain’t a PS5 showcase title.

I won’t comment much on the story, dialogue, voice acting but if you weren’t a fan of that in Remake it is still the same thing here. Let’s just say that the dialogue and voice acting come across as immature like a high school drama and all subtle nuance from the original is nowhere to be found.

Conclusion: An average game that feels rushed with lazy uninspired content and baffling design decisions.

Comentario: Den 1 Teil dieser Trilogie habe ich bereits durchgespielt und mochte echt gerne. Comentario: The problem with remakes is they are doomed from their announcement to be compared to the original. If you can set aside the original and judge this game as its own experience and let it stand on its own legs, it’s phenomenal. I was admittedly concerned when I read a few previews about how vast the size and scope of this game is. I was worried that they were falling into the recent trend of quantity over quality and the vast majority of the open world map would be empty and lifeless. I was pleasantly surprised. There are seemingly a million and a half things to do. Interesting landscapes filled with hidden gems to explore while offering a telling of the rich history of the world of Final Fantasy VII. The story is a departure from the original, but  still balances the intense dystopian science fiction aesthetic with a whimsical and sometimes silly sense of adventure that captures the spirit and charm of the original. Additionally, the departures from the original aren’t necessarily a bad thing. The combat mechanics take what works about the previous installment and improve upon them. Ultimately, above everything else, it’s a lot of fun. Which, to me, is the first l, second, third and fourth thing you need to ask yourself when determining the quality of a video game.

Comentario:
1) Narrative is simplified for general audience. "Show don't Tell" has left the building. More like "Just SHOW". Minus 1

2) Plot is meh. By the end of the game you are left with cliffhanging feelings. Not a complete game. Minus 1

3) Storytelling is based on fan service, especially by the end of the game. That means, some part of the story make sense only if you played any of the previous title, so once again, not a complete game. Minus 1

4) Some major characters are not part of the gameplay, unlike as they promised. Minus 1

5) Gameplay has not improved. ATM battles are joke, they removed the turn base from the game. My eyes really hurts with all these numbers flooding my screen. Minus 1

6) Graphics are the worst I have seen in a PS5 title. Many Graphical Glitches too.

7) Sound is Glitchy. Yes, it took me 2 hours to fix the audio bugs and lost 2 cutscenes. Minus 1

8) Cutscenes are just a soap opera. Really this is the best they can get in 2024? Plot is not moving, just characters recycle Information, half of the cutscenes could be removed without having any impact on the plot. Minus 1

9) Many, many, MANY CUTSCENES. I am aware that this is an ff title and the original is full of cutscenes but here, be prepare dialogues (which are again toned down for general audience) interrupting your gameplay, CONSTANTLY. Minus 1

10) The mini games **** and that includes the side quests. Minus 1

No thanks, finished the game day 4 and never gonna touch it again.

Comentario:
Lets get one thing straight. The game is a love letter to the compilation of Final Fantasy VII. It's what I'd like to describe as "Taking the best of a handful of games and jam packing them in one collective story." I wouldn't say that's a bad thing.

I think they did a tremendous job with the character development and the newly added "Synergy Abilities" encourages you to switch characters so you can perform combined powerful attacks.

The world is a mixed bag. Some might say the minigames are out of hand. I personally love them. Some locations give me this feeling I only experienced as a kid. When you arrive in a new town/city you'll find things to do that aren't available anywhere else. That's in my opinion is what separates a good RPG from a great one.

Back to the story tho. I understand why people would hate it. The story brings back the confusion that occurred in the previous game. It's confusing because they forced elements from the compilation into what we recognize as the original story. But once you take off the nostalgia glasses of what made the original a cult classic. You'll see this trilogy as "The Final Fantasy VII series as a whole."

All we have to do now is wait for Part 3 and pray that the game will answer the questions we still have after finishing Rebirth.
Comentario_Limpo: let get one thing straight game love letter compilation final fantasy vii id like describe taking best handful game jam packing one collective story wouldnt say thats bad thing think tremendous job character development newly added synergy ability encourages switch character perform combined powerful attack world mixed bag might say minigames hand personally love location give feeling experienced kid arrive new toxicity you find thing arent available anywhere else thats opinion separate good rpg great one back story tho understand people would hate story brings back confusion occurred previous game confusing forced element compilation recognize original story take nostalgia glass made original cult classic you see trilogy final fantasy vii series whole wait part pray game answer question still finishing rebirth

Comentario:
20 hrs in and 100%ing everything.

Tldr: Beautiful art, same combat as remake (play as tactical game not as action game or you'll suffer), play remake before you buy rebirth, its free on plus and ought to be beaten before this game. 

If you liked FF7 remake then this game is equal to or better in all aspects.  The story, music and art are all wonderful.  The scale of the world is great. I'd describe it as notably more free and open than FF15 and 16, but not wildly open like breath of the wild or elden ring.  You can freely roam the area of your current chapter, but not the entire world.  Some sections are on rails as well, as you'd expect, but nothing like FF7 remake

Combat is the same system with new complexities added in, and new materia.  The urge to play this like an action game always lurks around for me, as a big from soft fan, but it just doesn't work.  You almost have to mindset change to as if you are playing the original FF7 ATB system, where the action combat is a mini game to charge your ATB, rather than just waiting.  Not to say that the action combat doesnt matter. You just win and lose with your skill uses, not with dodging and mashing the square button.  The basic idea is to swap between characters frequently, charging their ATB gauges, and using the strategically correct abilities / spells as you go.  Some may not like this.  That being said, i haven't swapped the game to easy.  My guess is that you can just mash your way through the game on easy, you'd just be really missing the actual gameplay by doing so.

All in all, this is a great game.  Play FF7 remake first.  Its free on PS plus and relatively cheap.  It is an absolute shame to skip to rebirth without doing remake.  Put it on easy and 20 hr the story if you have to.  If you liked remake, youll like this.

Comentario:
i just read a 4-point user review that criticized the MUSIC.

There is a moment in chapter 4 where there is a live band playing off in the corner of a building in the fortress city of Junon. 

If you walk near the stage, you’ll be treated to an 8 minute Afro-Cuban jazz jamathon— provided you remain there for the duration. Through 4 chapters, there have been at least 40 distinct and substantial OST tracks. A few *side quests* have gotten their own dedicated pieces.

The compositions are varied and brilliant. Genius level stuff — same goes for the players actually performing the ones with live band recordings, it’s just relentless. 

We criticize AAA game development, justifiably at times… but if they keep ANYTHING from this formula, it has to be the dedication to music.

Generally one of jRPGs best contributions to gaming. Happy to report FF remains at the top of that mountain.

Comentario: Não sou o maior analista de vídeogames e talvez essa crítica contenha um pouco de nostalgia abordo dos anos magicos em que joguei o ff7 original. Mas você que está lendo com dúvidas se deve ou não comprar esse jogo apenas compre. O jogo consegue ser incrível e divertido tanto para novos fãs quanto para os puristas de Final Fantasy. A história continua fantástica, por mais que tenha alguns fillers aqui e outros ali, esses acabam sendo em sua grande maioria opcionais. O mundo aberto é um deleite a parte, não tenho palavras pra descrever o que é entrar em cidades como Nibelheim e ver ela cheio de vida com NPC's fazendo suas tarefas cotidianas. As quests secundárias melhoraram muito, não vá esperando algo no nível de qualidade de The Witcher 3, mas elas são boas o suficiente pra te entreter e te recompensar de acordo com o nível do desafio. Única crítica que eu tenho é em relação ao modo performance, que está com serrilhado estranho bem perceptível em telas maiores, mas o que aparenta ser algum problema de Anti aliasing que deve ser corrigido em updates futuros, mas nada que atrapalhe quem realmente queira jogar e experiênciar essa nova parte da aventura de um dos melhores Final Fantasy de todos.

Comentario: Rebirth is everything I could have wanted it to be and so much more.  This is the greatest Final Fantasy game that I have played in over 20 years.  The series is often stumbled over the past two decades but I feel with both remake and rebirth these games are return to Square' glory days. I was so intrigued by how they were going to pull off the second act of this trilogy knowing how much the original game opens up and expands after you leave midgar.  I didn't want to see another Final Fantasy 15 type situation of a vast open map with not a whole lot to do.  Thankfully the maps are jam-packed with things to see and do with multiple layers of things to unlock the encourages exploration the way it should be done in an open world game.  This game really sets a new standard in my opinion and I just don't see any other game topping this experience in 2024.

Comentario:
Gotta say Square Enix REALLY stepped it up with this game. Ive played both the original PS1 Final Fantasy 7 and FF7 Remake (part 1) and loved both though i had a rough time getting through the original due to out of date gameplay mechanics etc. The original stands the test of time and I 100% get the hype surrounding what many consider to be one of the all time great video game classics even if parts of it hold up better than others. Great story, music and characters. Admittedly I played part 1 of the remake before playing the original, but going back and playing the OG adds so much to the experience that id go as far to say you can't fully appreciate or understand the remake games unless youve played the original game first.

The original remake is great, the graphics are beautiful, it runs well considering everything and it did a fantastic job of translating the story for a new generation while also keeping the core of the FF7 which means so much to so many. Its 100% a tightrope that must be walked carefully and Square does a fantastic job.

 Final fantasy 7 rebirth doubles down on everything that made final fantasy 7 remake great, and then only adds on to it. Whereas final fantasy 7 remake was a relatively linear game, Final fantasy 7 rebirth is much more akin to an open world game. Every single part of this game fleshes out what the OG was trying to do in such an amazing way it really adds to your overall appreciation of the storyline in these games.
If you love story games and RPGs this is 100% a mustplay, though i recommended playing through the original before playing the remakes, you will still get alot of enjoyment out of it if you go in totally blind. Its one of the best RPGs ive ever played and if you consider **** play this game.

Comentario:
Simply breathtaking. I’ve waited so long for this, and not only does it not disappoint, but it far exceeds all hopes and expectations. The original FF7 raised the bar in the 90s, and today the second installment of the remake is setting a new bar for what a Final Fantasy game should look like, and any RPG for that matter. The graphics are stunning, but that’s just icing on the cake. The sheer scale, immersion and amount of stuff there is to do is what’s so captivating. FF7 Remake was outstanding, but it was very linear. The pivot to open world has been done spectacularly, and while many like myself are weary of huge empty and dead maps, there is no degree of that here. Running through rocky grassland with Cloud is satisfying as he can now jump, climb, swim and roll through a world with few artificial barriers. The battles and Synergy system takes it up a notch. Beyond that, the story of FF7 is without question an all time masterpiece that is still relevant today, if not even more so. The characters are so lovable, and NPCs have managed to make me laugh this time without being too cringe. 
There are a few bugs that the devs will need to iron out in the coming weeks, like floating foliage and an at times blurry performance mode (I am playing on Graphics), but this is a MASSIVE 150GB game from a relatively smaller team than other, similar AAA devs. There is so much to love that any of these issues are easily forgiven. I highly recommend and am a very firm 10/10 because of how the game goes above and beyond what’s expected - you are getting more than your money’s worth compared to what you pay the same for lesser titles. What an amazing comeback for the FF franchise! Square Enix, take a lesson from this team and build upon this in the next one.

Comentario:
I've played the game up to the start of chapter 10 so far, I'll withhold judgement on the ending, because it could go either way, but generally speaking I'm disappointed.

Performance is awful in performance mode with textures looking blurry and dated, Graphics mode gives a solid 30 FPS though. 

The absolute biggest problem is that this game just loves to waste the players time, the world is jam packed with time-wasting rubbish. The story is constantly interrupted by a seemingly endless stream of slow walk sequences, gap squeezing and minigames. Some of the minigames like Queen's Blood are worth playing, but the majority of them are tedious, boring, and utterly pointless, for example one side quest has you play a reoccurring Chocobo minigame to find mushrooms which you then have to play a minigame to pick. Every quest has this, the main story is constantly interrupted and the pacing is utterly suffocated by it. The game is probably 100+ hours to 100% and only around 20 of those are spent playing actual story content. The bloating doesn't stop at just minigames either, the entire world is a series of zones populated with Ubisoft towers and generic open-world map icon collecting nonsense, XP, AP, party levels and materia are all heavily tied to this nonsense, so while it's skippable your party will suffer for it. 

Navigation in the early zones is fine, but there are two midgame zones that are absolutely awful, the maps **** and combine that with verticality that doesn't specify where in the vertical space you're moving to, and it just adds tedium to the already tedious task of collecting up all the open world rubbish.

The audio, is a mixed bag, there are many faithful modern renditions of classic tracks, but for every one there's a number a modern electro remixes that just don't fit, and some new tracks that just miss the mark. 

Basically every flaw with Remake's combat still exists in Rebirth, attack telegraphing is poor, defence is slow meaning responding to attacks feels sluggish and sloppy. There are too many options to use in combat, with your core attacks, dodges, blocking, held inputs for specific commands, ATB menu commands, shortcuts, and sync abilities, it's confusing and extremely difficult to get into at a base level, although I'm sure a lot of depth exists if you take the time to master it.

The story, is fine for the most part, the bits where they stick to the original plot are fantastic, some stuff has been switched around for expedience or to make the journey flow better and that's fine. My biggest contention with the story is the whispers, metaverse subplot is bad writing and should never have been greenlit for this game, it adds nothing of value.

Comentario:
Negative:
- Too many minigames at every corner. Some of them are buggy or have very clumsy controlls and are forced to proceed the story or the sidequests.
- "Open Zone" exploration is not existent. Every single point of interest can be seen on the map beforehand, there are visual guides for every single thing leaving 0 real exploration. Most weapon chests are put directly next to rest spots and can even be bought if you missed them
-Too childish at most parts. It feels like im playing a kingdom hearts game. The core story is good though.

Positive:

-Soundtrack is great

-The battle system at its core is very good and the strong point. The only downside is the lack of choice. For example espers as well as sync skills are heavily streamlined and almost not useable in normal battles as they end to quickly.

- The graphics are good as well.


Overall i really hope they cut like 90% of the minigames in the third game and focus more on the options of the combat system. Whenever i entered a new zone after some story bits i thought whats the next minigame **** i need to deal with before i can enjoy the good parts of the game again

Comentario: Still giving it a perfect score. 56 Hours in.... The performance mode patch is icing the cake. This game has made me cry 5 times, the only game to invoke such emotion from me. Was the original in 97 and MGS 3s ending. This games story made me actually care. The cast here did a phenomenal Job, the only one I sort of dislike is Zacks VA but the voice fits. The music in this game is S Plus Rank Teir. No other sound tracks this year will even be able to stand next to this. I like all the mini games, and feel they have a lot of charm and are a fun distraction. And are all well designed especially the card game even though I'm not great at it. The Combat and the fact all the characters feel unique and are fun to use. On top of having the Materia system back with Chrono trigger style team attacks this alone gives it 8 whole points. The story is expanded in a lot of fantastic ways like Gongaga and the Shinra 8 boat Ride. And the Robed Guys actually care about them now, and it's nice to see the party trying to help them. The things people call padding or drawing out the story are exactly what I wanted with this project more detail more depth. More lore and immersion. Speaking of Lore the World Intel and the backstory about the Republic Of JUNON and all that are great and I like learning about it and reading about the past and even seeing Boxes with the Republic of Junons logo on them. on top of this I have 53 hours in the game I full cleared Grasslands and Junon and Corel and decided to rush to the end. This game goes above and beyond for the price of the game It is huge and has tons of things to do and see anyone scoring it less than a 9 is an absolute troll with an agenda. It def deserves a spot at the table for GOTY contender if not outright wins the whole damn thing. 10 out of 10.

Comentario: This game is good, not great.  Graphics are great.  Story is great.  Characters are great.  Gameplay is good, but a little more complicated than I personally like.  The real negative is the mini games and open world objectives that pad the story by dozens of hours.  One example is playing an hour of mini games to unlock swim suits so that you can progress to the next 20 minute section of the story.  It’s tedious for no reason.  This game is an example of “just because you could, doesn’t mean you should”.  The amount of hours you need to sink into unnecessary mini games to progress is absurd.  That being said, the stories, characters and graphics more than make up for the distractions in between.
